title: U.S. Stock Futures Edge Downas Economic Picture Dims
sub_head: Jobless claims jumped sharply last week, fresh data showed Thursday
body:
U.S. stock futures edged down Thursday as fresh data showed unemployment claims jumped sharply last week.
Futures tied to the S&P 500 ticked 0.3% lower, suggesting the broad-market index is on track for muted gains after the opening bell. Nasdaq-100 futures slid 0.6%, pointing to a second day of declines for tech stocks after Facebook was hit by a series of antitrust lawsuits.
Applications for unemployment benefits, a proxy for layoffs, rose sharply to 853,000 last week. It was more than economists had forecast. Separately, data also showed that consumer prices in November ticked up by 0.2%.
“Today’s increase in initial jobless claims is another sign economic momentum may be fading,” said Richard Flynn, a managing director at Charles Schwab.
The dimming economic picture may make it more imperative for Congress to pass a fresh fiscal-stimulus spending bill that would support businesses and households through the economic downturn, he said. Lawmakers have broadly agreed with the White House that the aid package should total around $900 billion, but key points of contention remain. A bipartisan group continued to negotiate late Wednesday.
